creator: long@ku.edu
text:
Compaq Tru64 4.0F doesn't like catalina.sh.  Specifically, when I run either
startup.sh or shutdown.sh I see messages in catalina.out such as:

usage: java org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina [ -config {pathname} ] [ -debug
] [ -nonaming ] { start | stop }

This appears to be due to the use of "$@" to insert the command line arguments
in the java command line.

If I change "$@" to just $@ it appears to work properly then.

creator: mdoyle@ubiquity.net
text:
The reason for this is the incorrect interpretation of the "$@" construct by 
the Tru-64 Bourne Shell.  If you change the first line of each ".sh" file in 
the tomcat bin directory to be 

#!/bin/ksh

i.e. use the Korn shell for the file instead of the /bin/sh that is there now, 
it works correctly.  Experimenting with "$@" on different OS (Solaris, AIX etc) 
shows Tru-64 to be incorrect.

Regards
Mike Doyle
Ubiquity Software Corporation

Michael, thanks for the explanation (and workaround). I don't think it would be
a good idea to put a workaround in the script itself for what is a bug in Tru64.
You may want to try the updated scripts from the HEAD branch (they're also in
the recent nightly builds) to see if you have more success with them.
